job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) in Danville, IN
pros: You are not just a number to this company. Everyone is friendly and really gets to know you. There are many employee retention events and training opportunities.
cons: Possibly working 12 hours if you don't like that. I do because I can get things done on my off days during the week.

pros: It's a cool job to have and you gain many experience. You get a free membership to their gym, pool, sauna, pretty much everything there. I learned how to use the rock wall and have climbers go up. I learned how to coach and ref games. It's pretty fun and chill. As a student, on nights where it wasn't so busy, I was allowed to get my laptop out and do homework, but this was on nights where I had to supervise the gym which was most nights. The one in a von has a subway inside, so on breaks, that's what I got to eat. There were also times where there was a function in the facility and we would get the extra food. Ymca also has cook outs for the kids, families, and employees.
cons: Cons were that the supervisors and managers were picky which certain things. Since covid hit, a few things have changed as well, like the rock wall being closed. I enjoyed it and work out on it a lot. Sometimes if you want more hours, you can't have additional time unless you ask for someone's spot for a night because of the budget. I only work three days and about three to four hours each day. Weekdays, if you apply to the activity leader position for the sports league you can only work later in the afternoon-night because that's when the sports take place. But if you work for the before and after school program (which I loved), you can work both super ealy in the morning like 5am-8am or around the time kids get out of school 3pm-6pm. You get paid more as well, $10 an hour.

pros: None it was terrible terrible
cons: The management doesn’t care about employees unless you’re a favorite. The neurology office degrades you if you’re over weight and shames you for it.

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Danville, IN
pros: The staff are amazing to work with! I met some lifelong friends while working there. Staff are very supportive of one another.
cons: The hospital used to feel like a family and the upper management were a big reason for that. But as time went on, it felt less and less like family and more like a business. I understand the hospital needs to make money but the intense focus on productivity for some of the specialty areas was too much. The policies that lower management had to implement was very difficult and made employees feel they had to prove their worth. It also made departments an uncomfortable place.

pros: Great company to work for! Competitive pay rates
cons: Some management roles need improvement.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Indianapolis, IN
pros: accessibility, community feel, positive atmosphere
cons: not much opportunity for improvement,

pros:
Close to home. 
Community oriented.
Manageable patient census.
cons:
Growth has created a disconnect with administration.
Administration changes have brought downtown ideas to the suburbs. Can we say St. Vincent - Danville?
Lower than average pay.
Managers are disconnected and spend all day in meetings or hiding.
Managers fail to keep up on standard of care, let licenses/certifications lapse, fail to lead by example.
Night shift doesn't exist in eyes of administration/management. Need something? Come in during the day on your day off...
Inability to freely communicate issues. If you have nothing nice to say - keep it to yourself.
Medical staff sit on patients for days,weeks, and months in never ending wait and see modes to avoid backlash for transferring patients even obviously appropriate.
Atmosphere of bonuses, rebranding, and telling employees how great everything is. All the while in the next breath saying we need a plan in case we have to lay you off and reminding you how thankful you should be to work for less than average industry pay.

This is not the Hendricks of the past. Pack your bags and move on. Indispensable doesn't apply to employees and while the new logo features "transparency" -- management does not.

review_title: Great Starting Ground Into Health Care
pros: Hendricks Regional Health is a fantastic place to work at. They have flexible hours depending on the position, train and encourage employees to reach their full potential, and a great family, friendly company. I have learned how to be a better coworker, leader, and overall individual during my time at Hendricks Regional Health.
cons: I would imagine that cons would vary per department, but the major issue Hendricks Regional Health has is adding too many projects. Many departments strive to do their best, but often overload themselves due to trying to please upper staff. This often leads people to become tired and unmotivated overtime.

review_title: CEO bringing in his unqualified friends for high paying jobs, at the expense of HRH
pros: Floor staff work together great, support each other and provide the best cares possible with being short staffed. Updated equipment available. Friendly, competent staff at the bedside level.
cons: Upper management, CEO, is a bully. Running off the better management, hiring his friends from St. V. Into high paying positions that they aren’t qualified for. Disrespectful to associates. Certainly does not follow the HRH philosophy! Narcissistic personality, definitely should not be in the position he is in. I will admit, in public he is friendly and seems to know what to say in order to hide his personal agenda. But please ask any of the many physicians, managers, even the chaplain, and more that have left after unbelievably rude, bullish encounters with this CEO.

pros:
90% of the personal from doctors and nurses, to housekeeping and office personnel are extremely friendly and professional... the other 10% seem to be full of themselves or immature.  

Pays better than other area small hospitals and great benefits
cons: They continue to take away the perks almost weekly... starting to feel like you're doing time instead of going to work.  Use to be an awesome place to work, now it seems to be making everyone angry and restless.  Management tends to put the money into useless things such as plants and pretty things instead of their people or the actual department in much need of repair

pros: Great group of people to work with who truly care about patient care quality.
cons: Since the narcissistic CEO moved in and replaced moat of leadership to "yes men", remaining leadership keeps their heads down, trying to make it to retirement. Extremely low moral from lower level employees all the way through management..

pros: Hendricks Regional Health was a great place to work. It was a family atmosphere, with extraordinary coworkers. It was an extraordinary place to work.
cons: Leadership has become dictators. They have stripped part timers of all benefits. It also leads by fear. Employees have the fear of loosing their jobs every day.

review_title: Great place to work. Love the environment and culture.
